item.title: About
item.description: I am a final-year PhD student (graduating September 2023) under the COMPASS CDT in the Institute for Statistical Science, University of Bristol. In my research I propose novel methods for statistical inference in latent variable models. My research is supervised by Dr Mathieu Gerber and Professor Anthony Lee. More broadly, I am interested in statistical learning theory and machine learning. My research interests include: Computational statistics, Kernel methods, Bayesian inference.

item.title: Portfolio
item.description: Below is small portfolio of my personal code and notes that I have written during my PhD. Notes and reports Statistical Methods 1 — Lecture Notes. Statistical Computing 1 — Reports which can be found below. An introduction to R Reproducibility Projects, version control, and packages Vectorization and parallel computing Functional and object-oriented programming Tidyverse Debugging and performance Matrices Numerical optimization Integration and Markov chain Monte Carlo Statistical Computing 2 — Reports which can be found below.
